text.p: True or False: If [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is finite-dimensional, and [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline], then every basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] must contain a basis of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline].

font.p: This is not true. For instance, the standard basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] does not contain a basis of the subspace spanned by [mathjaxinline]\left[ \begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 1 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline].
